text: Camaegeria aristura is a moth of the family Sesiidae. It is known from Uganda. This species is black and the tip of the abdomen has red-orange scales. It is similar to Camaegeria auripicta Strand, 1914, Camaegeria monogama (Meyrick, 1932) and Camaegeria sophax (Druce, 1899)Bartsch D. & Berg J., 2012. New Species and review of the Afrotropical clearwing moths genus Camaegeria Strand, 1914 (Lep.:Sesiidae: Synanthedonini). - Zootaxa 3181: 28-46 (2012), preview ==References== Category:Sesiidae Category:Moths described in 1931 Category:Insects of Uganda Category:Moths of Africa
title: Camaegeria aristura
